intro: Hysterophorus, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant features basal leaves that are typically lobed or toothed, and it produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Hysterophorus is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in arid environments. Its botanical structure supports its role as a hardy, ornamental plant in gardens and natural habitats.
